intro: Cyanea pilosa var. densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered Cyanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The leaves are usually opposite, ovate, and have a leathery texture with a slightly hairy surface. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal and lowland forest areas. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitat.
